SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

qsgs
Class Satellite

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--qsgs.Satellite
public class Satellite
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a satellite, and contains all data related to it, from its name to its Keplerian elements. Methods allow to calculate this satellite's position around the earth and relative to a ground station. To use this class: First define your sat, with its name exactly the same as the name in the Orbital Element (2-line elements) data file, and a descriptive full name (anything you like...). Then for orbit prediction you must set the orbital elements using setKeps() then periodically (and before getting any data) call calculatePosition(). You can always verify the age of the oribital elements by calling getKepsAgeDays(). After that, if you call calculatePosition() periodically with the right time, then you'll get the following info: verify if acquisition of signal is possible with isAOSPossible(), and if this sat is geostationary with isGeostationary(), the frequency shift caused by the Doppler effect with getDopplerCompensationAt435/146(), The remaining time before next acquisition and loss of signal with getAOS() and getLOS() or getNextAOSMinutes() and getNextLOSMinutes(), the distance between the sat and our reference ground station using getRangeKm(), its relative position using getElevation() and getAzimuth(), its footprint with getFootprintKm(), current velocity with getVelocityKmH(), altitude with getAltitudeKm, absolute position using getLongitude() and getLatitude(), and finally if the satellite is currently seen by our ground station using isVisible().

getLatitude

public int getLatitude()
Tells us the current latitude position of the satellate, acording to the last calculations performed.
Returns:
The latitude, 0 at equator, positive North, negative South, up to 90 deg.

getLongitude

public int getLongitude()
Tells us the current longitude position of the satellate, acording to the last calculations performed.
Returns:
The longitude, 0 at Greenwich, then positive towards west up to 359 back to greenwich.

getAzimuth

public int getAzimuth()
Tell us the azimuth position of this satellite, in degrees, according to the last calculation that was performed with the ground station set at the time of the calculations.
Returns:
Azimuth position of satellite, in degree, from our station. From 0 (North) to 359 degrees

getElevation

public int getElevation()
Tell us the elevation position of this satellite, in degrees, according to the last calculation that was performed with the ground station set at the time of the calculations.
Returns:
Elevation position of satellite, in degree, from our station. From -90 to +90 degrees (negative when under horizon...)

getRangeKm

public int getRangeKm()
Tells us the range, in kilometers, of the satellite from the specified ground station at the time of the last calculations.
Returns:
The distance between our ground station and the satellite, in kilometers.

getNextAOSMinutes

public double getNextAOSMinutes()
Tells us the amount of time we have to wait before the next pass of this satellite over the ground station specified at the time of the calculation.
Returns:
Number of minutes to wait before the next pass. Note that it is given in decimal format, so 8.5 is not 8 min 50 seconds, but 8 min 30 seconds.

getNextLOSMinutes

public double getNextLOSMinutes()
Tells us the amount of time we have to wait before the current pass of this satellite over the ground station specified at the time of the calculation completes.
Returns:
Number of minutes we still have for the current pass. Note that it is given in decimal format, so 8.5 is not 8 min 50 seconds, but 8 min 30 seconds.

getAOS

public long getAOS()
Tells us the time of the next pass, in UTC milliseconds
Returns:
The time, in milliseconds UTC, of the start of the next pass

getLOS

public long getLOS()
Tells us the time of the next end of pass, in UTC milliseconds
Returns:
The time, in milliseconds UTC, of the end of the next pass

getDopplerCompensationAt146

public int getDopplerCompensationAt146()
Tells us the frequency (in hertz) to add to the nominal frequency of satellite downlink, to compensate for the Doppler effect, when this nominal frequency is at around 146MHz. Rely on a previous orbit prediction pass.
Returns:
The frequency to add to the nominal radio frequency used to communicate with the spacecraft, to compensate for the Doppler effect.

getDopplerCompensationAt435

public int getDopplerCompensationAt435()
Tells us the frequency (in hertz) to add to the nominal frequency of satellite downlink, to compensate for the Doppler effect, when this nominal frequency is at around 435MHz. Rely on a previous orbit prediction pass.
Returns:
The frequency to add to the nominal radio frequency used to communicate with the spacecraft, to compensate for the Doppler effect.

public int getActiveUplinkFrequency()
Return an integer value representing the active uplink frequency in Hertz.

addDownlink

public void addDownlink(java.lang.String freq,
                        java.lang.String desc)
Adds a downlink definition to this satellite.
Parameters:
freq - Frequency in HERTZ (no points or formatting...)
desc - Description of the link (title...)

getFirstDownlink

public Link getFirstDownlink()
Returns the first downlink defined in the list for this satellite.
Returns:
The first radio downlink for this satellite.

getNextDownlink

public Link getNextDownlink()
Returns the next downlink in the list, for this satellite.
Returns:
The next downlink in the list, for this satellite.

getDownlinksCount

public int getDownlinksCount()
Tells us how many radio comm downlinks are defined for this satellite.
Returns:
The count of radio communication downlinks for this satellite.

public void setActiveDownlink(Link activeLink)
Allow us to select an active downlink for this satellite. This link will be used to set the radio, for example...

getActiveDownlinkFrequency

public int getActiveDownlinkFrequency()
Return an integer value representing the active downlink frequency in Hertz.

getNotes

public void getNotes(java.lang.String baseDir,
                     javax.swing.text.JTextComponent pane)
Returns text notes associated with this satellite. For now the notes are located in a file in the base directory
Parameters:
baseDir - Base directory where to look for note file
pane - Text field where to put the notes text.

saveNotes

public void saveNotes(java.lang.String baseDir,
                      java.lang.String notesText)
Save text notes associated with this satellite
Parameters:
baseDir - Base directory where the note files reside.
notesText - Text of the note.

setVerbose

public void setVerbose(boolean verboseSetting)
Allow us to set a mode where more messages are printed reguarding the status of this satellite.
Parameters:
verboseSetting - true to print more details.

calculatePosition

public void calculatePosition(GroundStation groundRef,
                              long refTime)
Calculates the position of the satellite from the current computer time, the keplerian elements of this satellite, and the ground station coordinates given.
Parameters:
groundRef - Reference ground station location
refTime - Reference time (in milliseconds since UTC epoch, 1970)
